verses.verse: Then<WH227> sang<WH7891> Moses<WH4872> and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> this<WH2063> song<WH7892> to the LORD,<WH3068> and spoke,<WH559> saying,<WH559> I will sing<WH7891> to the LORD,<WH3068> for he has triumphed<WH1342> gloriously: the horse<WH5483> and his rider<WH7392> has he thrown<WH7411> into the sea.<WH3220>

The LORD<WH3068> is my strength<WH5797> and song,<WH2176> and he is become<WH1961> my salvation:<WH3444> he is my God,<WH410> and I will prepare<WH4633> him an habitation;<WH5115> my father's<WH1> God,<WH430> and I will exalt<WH7311> him.
The LORD<WH3068> is a man<WH376> of war:<WH4421> the LORD<WH3068> is his name.<WH8034>
Pharaoh's<WH6547> chariots<WH4818> and his host<WH2428> has he cast<WH3384> into the sea:<WH3220> his chosen<WH4005> captains<WH7991> also<WH1571> are drowned<WH2883> in the Red<WH5488> sea.<WH3220>
The depths<WH8415> have covered<WH3680> them: they sank<WH3381> into the bottom<WH4688> as a stone.<WH68>
Your right<WH3225> hand,<WH3225> O LORD,<WH3068> is become<WH142> glorious<WH142> in power:<WH3581> your right<WH3225> hand,<WH3225> O LORD,<WH3068> has dashed<WH7492> in pieces the enemy.<WH341>

And in the greatness<WH7230> of your excellency<WH1347> you have overthrown<WH2040> them that rose<WH6965> up against<WH6965> you: you sent<WH7971> forth your wrath,<WH2740> which<WH834> consumed<WH398> them as stubble.<WH7179>

And with the blast<WH7307> of your nostrils<WH639> the waters<WH4325> were gathered<WH6192> together, the floods<WH5140> stood<WH5324> upright as an heap,<WH5067> and the depths<WH8415> were congealed<WH7087> in the heart<WH3820> of the sea.<WH3220>

The enemy<WH341> said,<WH559> I will pursue,<WH7291> I will overtake,<WH5381> I will divide<WH2505> the spoil;<WH7998> my lust<WH5315> shall be satisfied<WH4390> on them; I will draw<WH7324> my sword,<WH2719> my hand<WH3027> shall destroy<WH3423> them.
You did blow<WH5398> with your wind,<WH7307> the sea<WH3220> covered<WH3680> them: they sank<WH6749> as lead<WH5777> in the mighty<WH117> waters.<WH4325>

Who<WH4310> is like<WH3644> to you, O LORD,<WH3068> among the gods?<WH410> who<WH4310> is like<WH3644> you, glorious<WH142> in holiness,<WH6944> fearful<WH3372> in praises,<WH8416> doing<WH6213> wonders?<WH6382>
You stretched<WH5186> out your right<WH3225> hand,<WH3225> the earth<WH776> swallowed<WH1104> them.

You in your mercy<WH2617> have led<WH5148> forth the people<WH5971> which<WH2098> you have redeemed:<WH1350> you have guided<WH5095> them in your strength<WH5797> to your holy<WH6944> habitation.<WH5116>
The people<WH5971> shall hear,<WH8085> and be afraid:<WH7264> sorrow<WH2427> shall take<WH270> hold<WH270> on the inhabitants<WH3427> of Palestina.<WH6429>

Then<WH227> the dukes<WH441> of Edom<WH123> shall be amazed;<WH926> the mighty<WH352> men of Moab,<WH4124> trembling<WH7460> shall take<WH270> hold<WH270> on them; all<WH3605> the inhabitants<WH3427> of Canaan<WH3667> shall melt<WH4127> away.

Fear<WH367> and dread<WH6343> shall fall<WH5307> on them; by the greatness<WH1419> of your arm<WH2220> they shall be as still<WH1826> as a stone;<WH68> till<WH5704> your people<WH5971> pass<WH5674> over,<WH5674> O LORD,<WH3068> till<WH5704> the people<WH5971> pass<WH5674> over,<WH5674> which<WH2098> you have purchased.<WH7069>

You shall bring<WH935> them in, and plant<WH5193> them in the mountain<WH2022> of your inheritance,<WH5159> in the place,<WH4349> O LORD,<WH3068> which you have made<WH6466> for you to dwell<WH3427> in, in the Sanctuary,<WH4720> O LORD,<WH3068> which your hands<WH3027> have established.<WH3559>
The LORD<WH3068> shall reign<WH4427> for ever<WH5703> and ever.<WH5703>

For the horse<WH5483> of Pharaoh<WH6547> went<WH935> in with his chariots<WH7393> and with his horsemen<WH6571> into the sea,<WH3220> and the LORD<WH3068> brought<WH7725> again<WH7725> the waters<WH4325> of the sea<WH3220> on them; but the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went<WH1980> on dry<WH3004> land in the middle<WH8432> of the sea.<WH3220>

And Miriam<WH4813> the prophetess,<WH5031> the sister<WH269> of Aaron,<WH175> took<WH3947> a tambourine<WH8596> in her hand;<WH3027> and all<WH3605> the women<WH802> went<WH3318> out after<WH310> her with tambourines<WH8596> and with dances.<WH4246>

And Miriam<WH4813> answered<WH6030> them, Sing<WH7891> you to the LORD,<WH3068> for he has triumphed<WH1342> gloriously; the horse<WH5483> and his rider<WH7392> has he thrown<WH7411> into the sea.<WH3220>

So Moses<WH4872> brought<WH5265> Israel<WH3478> from the Red<WH5488> sea,<WH3220> and they went<WH3318> out into<WH413> the wilderness<WH4057> of Shur;<WH7793> and they went<WH3212> three<WH7969> days<WH3117> in the wilderness,<WH4057> and found<WH4672> no<WH3808> water.<WH4325>

And when they came<WH935> to Marah,<WH4785> they could<WH3201> not drink<WH8354> of the waters<WH4325> of Marah,<WH4785> for they were bitter:<WH4751> therefore<WH3651> the name<WH8034> of it was called<WH7121> Marah.<WH4785>
And the people<WH5971> murmured<WH3885> against<WH5921> Moses,<WH4872> saying,<WH559> What<WH4100> shall we drink?<WH8354>

And he cried<WH6817> to the LORD;<WH3068> and the LORD<WH3068> showed<WH3384> him a tree,<WH6086> which when he had cast<WH7993> into<WH413> the waters,<WH4325> the waters<WH4325> were made sweet:<WH4985> there<WH8033> he made<WH7760> for them a statute<WH2706> and an ordinance,<WH4941> and there<WH8033> he proved<WH5254> them,

And said,<WH559> If<WH518> you will diligently listen<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of the LORD<WH3068> your God,<WH430> and will do<WH6213> that which is right<WH3477> in his sight,<WH5869> and will give ear<WH238> to his commandments,<WH4687> and keep<WH8104> all<WH3605> his statutes,<WH2706> I will put<WH7760> none<WH3808> of these diseases<WH4245> on you, which<WH834> I have brought<WH7760> on the Egyptians:<WH4714> for I am the LORD<WH3068> that heals<WH7495> you.

And they came<WH935> to Elim,<WH362> where<WH8033> were twelve<WH8147> <WH6240> wells<WH5869> of water,<WH4325> and three score<WH7657> and ten palm<WH8558> trees: and they encamped<WH2583> there<WH8033> by the waters.<WH4325>
